result.execSummary:
The defendant Alaysia N. Brunson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alaysia N. Brunson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alaysia N. Brunson was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Alaysia N. Brunson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.   Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.   Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with Whittni C, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violations of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alaysia N. Brunson

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

02:01 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Alaysia N. Brunson, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and ADA Smathers puts the agreement on the record. Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 2 and 3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 1 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence on counts 2 and 3; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. No contact with Whittni C.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 1 day sentence credit if revoked.  Court cost and DNA surcharge ordered. DE shall pay any restitution that is determined. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant. Court will not grant expungement hearing at this time - defendant may petition the Court for reconsideration in 2 years by written request upon successful completion of probation.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22

Defendant, Alaysia N. Brunson, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

108PM   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am. Bond continued posted w/ same conditions (see bond entry). mi

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Alaysia N. Brunson, appeared.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No Attorney Assigned - is eligible for SPD services

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Whittni C, Jean W

Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.  $3000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
